For Sidonia and her fellow thrivers, for those we lost and for those still bearing the burden of hate and anti-Semitism today, we remember. 

#HolocaustRemembranceDay #WeRemember

I‚Äôve known Sidonia since middle school, and have been inspired by her ever since. She represents the best of humanity‚Äî courage, wisdom & ceaseless optimism. 

At 91, Sidonia is still fighting hate and instilling hope across our community & state. Today is our chance to honor her.

She made her way to Southern California, eventually settling in Sherman Oaks where she‚Äôs been a civic leader for decades. 

As Sidonia will tell you, she‚Äôs not just a survivor. She‚Äôs a thriver.

On this Holocaust Remembrance Day, I‚Äôm thinking of fighters like Sidonia Lax. 

Sidonia was born in Poland in 1927. At just fourteen, she was captured and jailed at Auschwitz. She survived‚Äî and when the war was over, she had no home to which she could return. https://t.co/twKETfZppe
